properties.notes: On 9 June 2022, in Thea Taw village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military and the Pyu Saw Htee fired guns and heavy weapons, raided the village at around 6 am and set fire to 31 houses, killing an elderly woman trapped inside a burnt house. The military also kept hostage of the 20 villagers who were trapped in the village.

On 9 June 2022, in In Ga Po village (Kyaikto township, Thaton district, Mon state), the drunk military soldiers shot an emergency vehicle from a volunteer service, killing the driver and injuring another volunteer near the village cemetery at night.
On 9 June 2022, in Pekon town (Pekon township, Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the military slapped a woman while investigating her in front of the Pekon City Hall.

On 8 June 2022, near Ya Thayt Taung village (Kyaukpadaung township, Nyaung-U district, Mandalay region), the military beat and shot dead a man on the way to Yathae Taung village. The victim was arrested three weeks ago from Hpet Taw Yae village.

On 6 June 2022, in Kan Pyar village of Myinmu township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), around 80 Myanmar military soldiers raided the village and an IDP camp near the village. After discovering a gun in a motorbike, around 20 military soldiers opened fire at 30 male IDPs while telling them to run within a count of 1 to 10. The military soldiers also destroyed around 50 motorbikes of IDPs and a monastery. Myanmar Now reports that at least six IDPs including a 16-year-old boy with mental illness were killed while the Irrawaddy reports that 11 civilians were killed.

On 6 June 2022, in Pu Hpar village (Demoso township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military opened fire at the IDPs who returned to the village to collect food and other supplies at around 10 am. There were no casualties as IDPs ran and escaped.

On 5 June 2022, in Daung Chan village (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a toddy palm farmer, took him to a wild almond tree farm near Nat Taung village, beat and killed him by setting him on fire. The reason for the arrest is unknown.

On 4 June 2022, in Hpa-An township (Hpa-An district, Kayin state), security forces (assumed to be military and police) shot and arrested a university student at a security checkpoint and tortured and killed him. The victim was a student who joined the civil disobedience movement.

Around 4 June 2022 (between 3 - 5 June), in Tha Yet Pin village (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the body of a 30-year-old refugee man who was arrested by the military on 3 June while returning to his home was found tied up near the Tha Yet Pin hospital on 5 June.

On 4 June 2022, in Kyaukpadaung township (Nyaung-U district, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military killed two university students from Bo Tew village who were accused of providing logistics support to the Kyaukpadung PDF. The two victims were arrested on 1 June 2022 during the military's raid of the village and were transferred to an interrogation centre at the Division 99 on 3 June. One victim was shot dead in the head during the interrogation the next day while another one died of excessive bleeding from the torture.

On 2 June 2022, between Tay and San villages (coded as Tay) (Saw township, Gangaw district, Magway region), 200 military soldiers abducted a farmer for navigation after raiding both Tay and San villages.

On 2 June 2022, in Si Mee village (Saw township, Gangaw district, Magway region), about 60 military soldiers from No (25) military's defense equipment factory stormed the village and arrested four men and one woman. One of the arrested men was tortured and died during the interrogation and he worked as a secondary supervisor participating in the Civil Disobedience Movement at the Saw Town People's Hospital. the NUG reported that a health worker who was arrested on 31 May 2022 died after being tortured by the military at an interrogation camp on June 2.

On 1 June 2022, near Mee Pauk village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), 30 military soldiers waited near the village and randomly abducted 12 farmers from Mee Pauk, Ywar Thit, Yone Htoe, Taung Pon and Myay Sa Kaung villages without proper reasons.

On 31 May 2022, in Kan Gyi (West) village (Kanbalu township, Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), around 20 Myanmar military soldiers and Pyu Saw Htee members in civilian clothing arrested and killed five villagers who were providing security for the village. Locals claimed that the villagers did not belong to any local defense force.

On 30 May 2022, in Nyaung Chaung village (Kyauktaw township, Mrauk-U district, Rakhine state), the Myanmar military division 55 stationed at Maha Muni Pagoda fired around 30 artillery founds and gunfire with around 500 shots at Maha Muni and Nyaung Chaung IDP camps. IDPs were forced to flee when the shooting began. The reason for the attack was unknown as there was no fighting. There were no casualties.

On 29 May 2022, in Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military arrested and killed two villagers who were farming near Pint Thar village. Their bodies were found the next day near the village.
On 25 May 2022, near Ywar Thar Yar village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military found two IDPs who were in hiding and killed them.

Around 25 May 2022 (between 23 - 26 May), near Kyauk Khwet village (Myaing township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military abducted 6 civilians as human shields from Kyauk Khwet, Baunt Bin, Baw Ton, and Than Chaung villages on around 23 May. The abductees were tortured and killed in military's custody and their bodies were discovered at a 3-mile distance from Kyauk Khwet village on 26 May.

Around 25 May 2022 (between 24 - 26 May), in Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military killed an IDP from Bant Bway Taw Pyin village. He was arrested on 24 May and his body was found in Thanakha farm on 26 May.

Around 25 May 2022 (week of), in Thit Cho village (Ayadaw township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested, abused and killed a civilian for unknown reasons. The body was found later covered with scars on the back and the head.

Around 25 May 2022 (week of), in Ge Thar Hmway village (Ayadaw township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested, beat and killed a CDM teacher from the village. His body was found 4 days after the arrest.

On 25 May 2022, in Shwe Twin Kone village (Ayadaw township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and fired guns and heavy weapons targeting the civilians, killing 3 elders and injuring 7 villagers. Also, the military set fire to 89 houses, rice storage houses, and some farm equipment that belongs to the villagers.

Around 23 May 2022 (between 22 - 23 May), in Te Gyi village of Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), four bodies of civilians, including two women (ages 20 and 24) killed by the Myanmar military troops, were discovered on 23 May. The military raided the village on May 22.

On 20 May 2022, in Myinmu township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military shot at a vehicle on the Mandalay-Monywa road for not stopping. The vehicle carried a family of 4 and 1 of them (a third year medical student) was shot in the head and killed.

On 20 May 2022, in Chaung Yoe village (Taze township, Shwebo district, Mandalay region), the Irrawaddy reported that a military column of about 180-200 soldiers stormed the village and arrested and beat two villagers. They also set about 500 houses on fire, mostly owned by Christian families.
On 15 May 2022, in Hnaw Yoe village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), military forces killed a refugee who was a local fisherman and set five houses on fire at around 7 am.
On 15 May 2022, in Myo Thit village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military killed a civilian who was in his 70s and arrested a civilian and a Buddhist monk.

Around 12 May 2022 (between 11 - 13 May), in Shwedaung town (Shwedaung township, Pyay district, Bago-West region), a 47-year-old man who was arrested by the military on 11 May was killed in an interrogation. His family was informed on 13 May.
On 12 May 2022, near Taung Boet village (Myaing township, Pakokku district, Magway region), military soldiers fired heavy and small weapons and killed a 20-year-old woman.

On 11 May 2022, in Twantay township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), security forces (assumed to be military and police) opened fire when checking the guest list in Oehpo ward. Security forces beat and arrested five university students at around 11:40 pm for not reporting the guest list. It is unknown where the students were taken to.
On 11 May 2022, in Myo Paw village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), military forces shot dead a 37-year-old farmer as he fled when the military raided the village.

On 9 May 2022, in Ma Ra Thein village (Tigyaing township, Katha district, Sagaing region), an elderly man was killed in the fire as the Myanmar military set five houses on fire. The military also shot dead two women who were trying to put out the fire.
On 7 May 2022, in Thanlyin township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), a woman was raped by two sergeant of the military at around 4 pm.

On 6 May 2022, in Kan Thit (East) village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military raided the village and set 47 houses on fire in the village at around 3 am. An elderly woman and some cows were killed in the fire. Villagers fled from the village due to the raid.

On 6 May 2022, in War Tan village (Salingyi township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), about 100 military soldiers and more than 150 Pyu Saw Htee members, armed with 5 RPGs and 150 mm weapons, occupied the village and abducted a monk (the Vice-Chairman of the Monywa Town Central Sangha Maha Nayaka Group) as a hostage.

On 5 May 2022, in Tha Hpan Kaing village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military forces entered the village at around 7:30 pm and arrested two women and stabbed them with bamboo sticks. They were severely beaten on the head and body. One house in the village was set on fire.
Around 4 May 2022, in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the Myanmar military arrested 7 civilians (including 6 women) and conducted abuses on the arrestees.

Around 2 May 2022, in Oke Hpo village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military (LIB-77) shot and killed 9 IDPs, including elders, sheltering at the Yaw Ki Taw Monastery meditation center. Their bodies were discovered on 3 May at around 8 am. The reason for the attack was unknown.

On 29 April 2022, in Sagaing township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), military forces chased and fired at a car as it drove away during inspection at the Nyaung Pin Wun Bridge on the Monywa-Mandalay highway at around 2 pm. Two women riding motorcycles on the bridge were shot by the military. One died on the spot and another was injured and taken to a hospital.
On 29 April 2022, in Me Thei village (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), military forces entered the village and shot four ipds, killing one of them.

On 25 April 2022, in Ta Khun Taing village tract of Kyainseikgyi township (coded as Kyainseikgyi) (Kawkareik district, Kayin state), the military forces abducted more than 30 local villagers who were working in the rubber plantations at the foot of the Taung Nyo mountain range at around 11 am. They were released later.

Around 24 April 2022, in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the military forces arrested a teacher, one man and three women by accusing them of having a connection with and helping two military soldiers who defected the military along with their weapons. The two soldiers were from the Matupi military strategic base who were assigned to guard the Myanmar Economic Bank. The military announced to release five victims in exchange for two defected soldiers. Five victims are tortured during interrogation and one of the women has been taken to the hospital.

On 23 April 2022, in Tha Pyay Thar village, Wuntho township (Kawlin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military troops shot dead two local civilians, including Buddhist Monk and a woman. They also arrested two others.

On 23 April 2022, near Kun Si Kan and Myauk Lu Kan village (coded as Myauk Lu Kan) (Pakokku township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the Myanmar military fired gunshots at the farmers who were working in the farm between Kun Si Kan and Myauk Lu Kan villages at around 9 am. The reason of the attack was unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 22 April 2022, in Aungpan town (Kalaw township, Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), military soldiers beat a woman as she was looking at them while they were searching the house of a man and his sister who run the blacksmith business. The soldiers accused the man and his sister of providing tools and equipment for the protests in Aungpan.

On 19 April 2022, in Pe Yin Taung village (Ywangan township, Danu Self-Administered Zone, Shan-South state), the Myanmar military killed the 6 arrestees who were arrested on 17 April 2022 and set them on fire with car tires.

Around 14 April 2022 (between 12 - 18 April), in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military forces arrested a 50-year-old wife of the vice chair of the NLD party - Mandalay district in Mahar Nwe ward on 12 April as they were unable to find him. She died during interrogation on 18 April. The body was dumped on April 18 in front of the Fire Station near the Gora Stadium (Mingalar Market New Market) on 35th Street. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 13 April 2022 (between 13 - 14 April), in Pazundaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), a young man who was arrested by the military after the bombing against the YMBA head office on 13 April was killed during interrogation.

On 13 April 2022, in Shar Hla village, Seikphyu township (Pakokku district, Magway region), an 80-year-old woman was killed in a house set fire by the Myanmar military forces. She was unable to escape when the military carried out an arson attack in the village.
On 12 April 2022, in Ho Nawng Ka Bar village, Kutkai township (Muse district, Shan-North State), a military soldier attempted to rape a 50-year-old woman at around 9 am in Ho Nawng village.

On 11 April 2022, in Shar Hla village of Seikphyu township (Pakokku district, Magway region), the military and Pyu Saw Htee members raided the village and burned a 84-year-old woman, who was sleeping in a village tent, to death.

On 10 April 2022, in Magway town of Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), the military troops detained a 19-year-old man along with his two female friends for riding a motorcycle. A boy was shot dead in custody.
On 10 April 2022, in Set Kant village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military troops raided the village and killed a displaced 28-year-old woman by slitting her throat.

Around 9 April 2022 (between 8 - 10 April), in Kale town (Kale district, Sagaing region), a civilian young man, who was mistakenly shot and arrested by the Myanmar military troops in Tahan Ward on April 8, died in military's custody. The family was informed to retrieve his body on April 10.

On 8 April 2022, in Kwee Chei Hpawt village of Waw Lay Myaing sub-township (Myawaddy township, Myawaddy district, Kayin state), two Karen farmers were shot dead by the patrol military forces on their way with a tractor to the village.

On 8 April 2022, in Kin village of Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), two civilians (29 and 50 years old civilians) who were arrested by the Myanmar military force on 7 April were killed and set on fire on 8 April. Their bodies were discovered inside a burned house on 11 April.

On 6 April 2022, in Za Kyan village (Taungtha township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), a 20-year-old mentally ill woman was raped by a soldier who was providing security for exam takers at a high school.
On 5 April 2022, in Nga Ta Yaw village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military troops shot dead a 50-year-old female.

On 5 April 2022, in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), military forces arrested a 28-year-old woman, the mother of a four-year-old boy, who was arrested by the military as a hostage on 5 April near BOC bus station. She was accused of providing support to the PDF and carrying out explosions. The military hit with a car, shot and arrested her.

On 4 April 2022, in Htei Hlaw village (Gangaw township, Gangaw region, Magway region), the military forces tied up a man and killed him and his 14-year-old daugher who were internally displaced people (IDP). Locals claimed the 14-year-old daughter was raped before being killed but the DVB could not verify independently. Another source, the NUG, reported that they were beat and burned to death.

Around 4 April 2022, in Kin village, Madaya township (Pyioolwin district, Mandalay region), a Buddhist monk who was arrested on 3 April in Kin village by the military force, following the killing of a 47-year-old monk killed by an unidentified armed group, died in custody on 4 April.

Around 4 April 2022, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme district, Shan-North State), a civilian from Pang Woe village who was arrested by the Myanmar military forces following a bomb explosion at Municipality Office died during the military's interrogation.

On 3 April 2022, in Hpyon Bu village, Yesagyo township (Pakokku district, Magway region), the military forces shot dead a woman visiting from Kyaukphu village in the morning. They also set almost all the houses in the village on fire.
On 2 April 2022, in Chan Yar village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region),Myanmar military shot and killed a local woman who was an IDP from other village.

On 26 March 2022, in Tha Yet Tan village (Amarapura township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military forces arrested and tortured four locals including a 11-year-old Grade 5 student while in custody, accusing them of providing support to PDFs. Two of them were released later.
On 25 March 2022, in Kawkareik township (Kawkareik district, Kayin state), the military shot at and killed one Free Burma Ranger medic while giving medical aid to the wounded.

On 22 March 2022, near Kyan Thar village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), military forces and Pyu Saw Htee arrived and opened fire at farmers who were harvesting beans in the farmland. They arrested a 40-year-old farmer from the Tin Thar village and killed him at a cemetery.

On 20 March 2022, near Wei Paung village of Ye township (Mawlamyine district, Mon state), a volunteer-cum-aid worker died in a military interrogation after being denied medical access. He was injured and arrested during the clash between the military and MSRU members on 18 March.

On 20 March 2022, in Myo Kone village of Kawhmu township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), the military raided a monastery where Arr Man local charity organization is located in, claiming they are PDF members and shot and killed the chair of the charity organization for trying to escape during the raid. The military also arrested two cousins of the chair afterwards.

Around 17 March 2022 (as reported), in Kyaw village (Mingin township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military troops raped two women at their 30s multiple times. Both committed suicide by hanging themselves ten days later.

Around 16 March 2022 (between 15 - 17 March), in Maubin town (Maubin township, Maubin district, Ayeyarwaddy region), a 19-year-old man, who was detained by the military on 15 March on suspicion of providing support to PDF, died on 17 March after being tortured to death in custody.

On 15 March 2022, in Labutta town (Labutta township, Ayeyarwady region), military forces beat and arrested a 19-year-old youth in ward 2, accusing him of being a PDF member. He was killed on 17 March during interrogation.
On 14 March 2022, in Pan Kan village of Loikaw township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), a displaced man, who was returning to village due to lack of food, was killed by the military troops.

On 14 March 2022, in Shwe Hlay village (Chaung-U township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military troops and Pyu Saw Htee members raided the village and shot dead a farmer and wounded a woman. They set fire to nearly 50 houses.

Around 13 March 2022, in Paungde town of Paungde township (Pyay district, Bago-West region), the military arrested three people on suspicion of having connection with the PDF. They were beaten during interrogation and released after signing confession letters.

Around 13 March 2022 (as reported), in Min village of Natogyi township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military arrested nine civilians after two military informants were killed on 12 March. One of the detainees was found dead later.

On 12 March 2022, in Sein Sar village of Taze township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), following a clash with local defense groups, the military came back the village at around 12 pm and opened fire and killed a 15-year-old girl. They also set houses on fire, killing a 70-year-old woman who could not run. Total of five houses were burned down.

Around 12 March 2022 (between 10 - 13 March), in Nattalin township (Thayarwady district, Bago-West region), 3 Phoenix Defense Force members died in a military interrogation. They were arrested in Taung Nyo Kywat Thit on March 10 and their bodies were discovered on March 13 at a military hospital.

On 12 March 2022, in Botahtaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the military beat and arrested five university students who participated in protests from Ward No.10 at around 11 pm. They were brought to military interrogation.

On 8 March 2022, in Let Pan Taw village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), military forces raided the village and opened fire with small arms and heavy weapons. Eleven refugees including two children sheltering at the monastery were killed when artillery shells hit them. AAPP reported nine civilians, including two children, were killed by the artillery shelling. Two houses were set on fire. Fatalities coded as 9.

On 8 March 2022, in Kan Thar village, Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), an elderly woman who was taking shelter at Kantha's monastery was killed during a raid by the military, and some civilians from Kan Thar and Let Pan Taw were also arrested.
On 8 March 2022, in Nat Myaung village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), a 40-year-old villager on his way back from a farm was shot dead by the military near the village cemetery.

On 6 March 2022, in Wai La Mu village of Kyunhla township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military shot and killed two villagers. They were arrested together with two teachers participating in the civil disobedience movement (CDM).

properties.assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Myanmar (2021-); Pyu Saw Htee
properties.notes: On 5 March 2022, in Inn Nge Daunt village (Pauk township, Pakokku district, Magway region), a total of 70 military soldiers, police and Pyu Saw Htee stormed the village and fired heavy artillery. They also arrested a 42-year-old mother and her 4-year-old daughter while they were preparing to flee. The mother was raped and killed in front of her house and her 4-year-old daughter was stabbed to death in the chest. The military arrested twenty nine locals, including nine children as hostages. The 11-year-old daughter of the mother was later found dead at a creek near the village. Fatalities coded as 3. [women targeted: girls]

On 5 March 2022, in Tigyaing township (Katha district, Sagaing region), a 21-year-old man from Bo Te Kone village who was a member of a local defense force was killed by the military after he was arrested on 2 March. His body was found under a pile of sawdust near Kyauk Aik village. According to a member of the Tigyaing PDF said that he was a member of a local guerrilla group that had been involved in attacks against military convoys using explosives.

On 1 March 2022, in Tha Pyay Aye village (Yinmabin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), military forces set fire to houses. An elderly woman who did not managed to escape was killed after the village was set on fire.

On 27 February 2022, near Loi Yin Min Ga Lar village of Pekon township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the military shot and killed four displaced civilians who returned to their farms and to collect rations.

On 26 February 2022, in Chin Pone village of Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military held 200 locals including 80 kindergarten kids and teachers from nursery and religious training school as hostages. They were released on 28 February.

On 25 February 2022, in Mayangone township (Yangon-West, Yangon region), the Myanmar military forces raided homes in ward 3 where students from Townships Students' Unions (ABFSU) were staying and shot them for joining an anti-coup protest. A former president of Basic Education Student's Union (ABFSU) was killed and eight others were injured.
On 24 February 2022, in Zaw Chaung village of Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military beat and killed an IDP.

On 23 February 2022, in Chaung Gwa village of Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military arrived at a temporary hut in which a family of three members, the mother and two daughters, were hiding and shot and killed them before setting them on fire. The CDF and CNDF discovered their remains the next day.

On 22 February 2022, in Ngar Hpar village (Kale township, Kale district, Saging region), military forces killed two civilians when they met them on the way. One of them was a cowherd who was herding cattle and another was a person with mental disability who was picking up flowers. The military also set fire to a house.
On 21 February 2022, in Chauk town (Chauk township, Magway district, Magway region), military forces arrested and tortured 20 high school students who were distributing anti-military leaflets.
On 20 February 2022, in Kan Lay Kone village of Taze township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), three military soldiers stationed in the village raped a 20-year-old married woman.

On 20 February 2022, in Sagaing town of Sagaing township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), a 17-year-old student, who was a PR coordinator of A Lin Tan private school students' union, died in military custody, according to the A Lin Tan Students' Union.

On 15 February 2022, in Yae Wai Ywar Gyi village, Thaton township (Thaton district, Mon State), light and heavy weapons fired by the Myanmar military force hit a woman and destroyed three houses in Yae Wai Ywar Gyi village.

On 14 February 2022, in Nwar Ban Gyi village, Ywangan township (Danu Self-Administered Zone, Shan State), the Myanmar military forces shot dead a 21-year-old civilian who was returning home from his farm. The military forces also arrested three local civilians for unknown reason.

On 11 February 2022, in Myitkyina town (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina district, Kachin state), the military troops gave chase to a car carrying six young people in Si Tar Pu ward and shot at it at around 11 pm. A woman was shot dead in the chest and other one was injured in the legs. Five other youths were arrested. It was reported that they drove away when the military ordered them to stop the car.
On 9 February 2022, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military raided the Thingaza monastery and beat up and arrested a monk from the Mandalay Monks Union' Strike.

On 9 February 2022, in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military raided the house activists were living in, beat up and arrested four at around 6pm. Two of the arrestees were protest leaders and two others were citizen journalists.

Around 8 February 2022 (week of), in Kale town (Kale district, Sagaing region), a 53-year-old man who was arrested on Nat Chaung Road near Chan Myay Hospital by the Myanmar military forces on 1 February died in custody on 8 February.

Around 7 February 2022 (between 4 - 10 February), at the west of Hseng Hpa Yar village in Hpakant township (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), the military shot and killed a person with disabilities and buried his body to leave no evidence. He disappeared on February 4 while running away from fighting that took place near his farm around Mar Nawt Hmaw village.

Around 7 February 2022, in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), a man arrested by the military troops and Pyu Saw Htee members died during interrogation and his family members were informed to retrieve his body in the morning.

On 4 February 2022, in Kyauktan township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), military forces opened fire at a car in front of the general administration office. One 20-year-old woman in the car was seriously injured.

On 1 February 2022, in Kale town (Kale district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military forces shot dead a 42-year-old school teacher on her way to visit her mother living in Thazin Ward. The reason for the killing of the teacher was unknown.

On 31 January 2022, in Bago town (Bago district, Bago region), the Myanmar military forces shot and killed a late-term pregnant woman at a Pharmacy located on Inn Win (10) road at around 9 pm for unknown reason.

On 31 January 2022, in Pa Dat Taing village of Myinmu township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military raped a 13-year-old girl and killed her by stabbing her into pieces and setting her on fire. [women targeted: girls]

Around 28 January 2022 (between 27 - 28 January), in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), a man who was arrested by military forces at a military checkpoint in Tar Han ward on 27 January was killed on 28 January during interrogation.
On 27 January 2022, in Thet Kei Kyin village of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested five locals. One of five detainees was killed.

On 27 January 2022, in Kan Lel village of Kawlin township (coded as Kawlin) (Kawlin district, Sagaing region), two 60 mm bullets fired by the military forces stationed in the Nga Pway Gyi ward fell on a house and one exploded. The mother and her daughter in the house were injured.
On 26 January 2022, in Mogoke town of Mogoke township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military fired at a motorbike that a woman and a child were riding on and injured the woman.

On 19 January 2022, in Namhkan town of Namhkan township (Muse district, Shan-North state), the military based in MantKham security checkpoint in Ward (No.1) and at the fire department office in Ward (No.2) fired light rounds indiscriminately to the surroundings and injured a 60-year-old woman who was praying at her home.

On 18 January 2022, in Kwayt Chaung village, Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military forces fired at civilians who were on the run from Kwayt Chaung village and injured a woman. Local civilians from six villages, including Bant Bway (Ywar Ma), Htan Zin, Let Pan, Kan Su, Na Bu Taw, and Kwayt Chaung fled homes in fear of the advancing Myanmar military forces.

On 18 January 2022, in Nyaung To village, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military forces stationed in Nyaung To village shot dead a woman who was cooking beans in early morning for releasing smoke.

On 17 January 2022, in Hin Thar village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military and Pyu Saw Htee arrived in the village with two trucks, raided a monastery and arrested a monk and two villagers. The military troops beat up one of villagers.

On 16 January 2022, in Kan Gyi village (Saw township, Gangaw district, Magway region), the military abducted five youths who are about 15-year-old and a monk and used them as human shields. The military troops also confiscated 15 homemade guns at the village's monastery.

On 9 January 2022, in Webula village (Falam township, Falam district, Chin State), the military abducted five civilians who had returned from farming and used them as human shields. Two of them were released again.

On 7 January 2022, in Na Bet village, Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region) the Myanmar military forces stationed in Na Bet village killed a Buddhist Monk and a civilian at around 8 am for unknown reason.

On 4 January 2022, in Nga Tan village (Taze township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces shot and arrested a 19-year-old student from Sagaing Education College and a 17-year-old young man who were travelling to Khin-U on a motorcycle. They were arrested on suspicion of being PDF members. Both of them were injured.

Around 3 January 2022 (between 2 - 3 January), in Kyauk Myaung town of Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a man was killed during military interrogation. He was arrested on January 2 with three others and brought to the military's LIB-12 base. Neighbors heard screaming, begging and forced chanting such as 'the revolution will fall.' His family was told to retrieve his dead body the next day.

Around 2 January 2022 (between 1 - 3 January), in Tamwe township (Yangon-East, Yangon region), a man who was arrested on 1 January by military forces who were conducting checks at his home for overnight guests later died during interrogation. His family was informed of his death on 3 January.

Around 1 January 2022 (between 31 December - 2 January), in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), a local celebrity who was one of the six civilians arrested by the military forces on 31 December 2021 died in custody on 2 January 2022.

On 31 December 2021, in Kone Yoe village of Ye-U township (coded as Ye-U) (Shwebo district Sagaing region), the military forces from Ywar Thar Ywar and In Taw villages shot two farmers near the cemetery while stopping at the Kone Yoe village cemetery. One of the two farmers was hit by a bullet and injured and the other escaped.

On 29 December 2021, in Shein Ma Kar village of Wetlet township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a group of approximately 50 military and Pyu Saw Htee members entered the village and shot and killed a shepherd they encountered on the street.

On 27 December 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), a student activist was killed in a military interrogation center. His body was cremated at Yayway Cemetery on the same day without informing his family members. He was arrested on December 26. Location coded as Tamwe.

Around 27 December 2021 (as reported), in Pakokku town (Pakokku district, Magway region) a 43 year-old man who was arrested for alleged supporter of People's Defense Force (PDF) on 25 October died in military custody on 27 December.

On 26 December 2021, near Hin Aun village Shwegu township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), the military shot and killed a primary teacher, who went to find woods, for running away from the fighting that took place nearby.

Around 26 December 2021 (as reported), in Nat Chaung village, Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military forces stationed in a school shot and killed a woman on a motorcycle who was passing in front of the school.
On 23 December 2021, in Myaungmya township (Myaungmya district, Ayeyarwady region) a civilian who was arrested and beaten by the Myanmar military.
On 21 December 2021, in Thea Hpyu Chaung village of Bilin township (Thaton district, Mon state), following the fighting with the KNLA, the military shot and killed a female farmer for trying to run.

On 21 December 2021, in Similaw village (Pekon township, Taunggyi district, Shan-south), the military troops raided the village and arrested six cowboys and demanded three cows. All of them were beaten and released again.

Around 21 December 2021 (between 20 - 21 December), in in Kan Hla village, Lewe township (Det Khi Na district, Nay Pyi Taw Territory), a 36-year-old school teacher (Muslim) who was arrested on 20 December died in military's custody on 21 December. The schoolteacher was participating in the civil disobedience movement.

Around 20 December 2021 (between 18 - 21 December), in Kyauk Hpyar village, Thabaung township (Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), a civilian who was first arrested by the Myanmar military forces on 18 December died in custody on 21 December.

Around 19 December 2021 (between 17 - 21 December), in Son Kone village of Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military shot and killed three villagers who were arrested on December 17 along with seven others. Locals found their bodies buried in the soil when about 200 military troops stationed in the village left on 21 December.
On 15 December 2021, near Shwe Pauk Pin village of Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), the military abducted three farmers and released them later in the evening.
On 14 December 2021, in Htone Gyi village of Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military set some houses on fire and killed a farmer and his wife.

Around 13 December 2021 (between 12 - 13 December), in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military arrested and killed a secretary of the Mahar Kusalakari social services group in a military interrogation. He was taken in the evening of December 12 and his family was informed about his death next day. The family witnessed bruises on his head, face and body.

On 13 December 2021, in Nyaungdon town of Nyaungdon township (Maubin district, Ayeyarwady region), about 60 military soldiers raided a local charity organization named Pe Ti and beat up and arrested four members of the charity group. They were released on 14 December.

On 12 December 2021, in Kanpetlet township (Mindat district, Chin state), the military shot in the head and killed a Christian pastor, who was arrested on December 1 on his way home to Oak Pho village.

Around 12 December 2021 (between 10 - 14 December), in Latha township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), a freelance photo journalist was killed in the military interrogation. He was arrested with another freelance photo journalist on December 10 while taking photos of the nationwide silent strike against the Myanmar military coup.

On 12 December 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa district, Sagaing region), around 200 Myanmar military forces beat three monks and arrested 12 youths, including a journalist who is under 18 year-old and working for the Regional News Agency at around 2 pm at Ahlone Monastery for unknown reason.
On 12 December 2021, in Mindat town (Mindat district, Chin State), the Myanmar military forces randomly opened fire in Mindat town and killed a 40 year-old woman.

Around 12 December 2021 (between 10 - 14 December), in Yangon city (Yangon, Yangon region), a 30-year-old freelance photographer who was arrested on 10 December was killed in custody. His close friends were told to retrieve his body on 14 December. He was one of the two photographers who was arrested by the military on 10 December after going out to record the 'Silent Strike' campaign in Yangon.

On 12 December 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military forces on guard fired three shots at a man who was driving his pregnant wife, a nurse, to Cital Hospital on a motorcycle in front of 300-bed hospital on 62nd street for not stopping as they instructed. He were killed on the spot and his wife died in a hospital.

On 11 December 2021, in Ka Det Nge Htein village (Launglon township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), the military forces raided a house and cut the female owner of the house as they found political things on her phone. They also beat and arrested two men at a motorcycle shop. They were released with injuries later.

On 10 December 2021, in Myaing township (Pakokku district, Magway region), the military entered the public hospital and beat up six health workers - doctors and nurses - who were playing guitar and singing in their dormitory.

On 10 December 2021, in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), the military beat up and locked up 89 political prisoners in solitary confinement including the ABFSU vice-chair, Yangon Education University Students Union vice-chair, and the Yangon University Students Union member for participating in the nationwide silent strike against the Myanmar military coup.

Around 9 December 2021 (as reported), in Kawng Hwet village, Pekon township (Taunggyi district, Shan State), a local who was first arrested by Myanmar military forces on 12 November was found dead with gunshot wounds on 9 December.

Around 8 December 2021 (between 6 - 9 December), in Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), a Christian Pastor who was first arrested on 6 December 2021 died in Magway hospital on 9 December after being held in military custody and tortured in Sidoktaya military base for alleged member of Chinland Defense Force.

On 7 December 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), following three explosions at the ward administration, the military opened fire in a residential area in Aung Thar Yar ward and killed a five-year-old who was playing in her yard at the house across the ward administration. [women targeted: girls]

Around 6 December 2021 (between 5 - 6 December), in Myeik town (Myeik township, Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), a 40-year-old man in his home who was arrested on suspicion of being a PDF member and later informed his family to come to the cemetery to bury his body.

Around 6 December 2021 (between 3 - 7 December), in Oo Myay Htoo village of Kale township (coded as Kale) (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military killed a Chaung Kwa villager and set him on fire. They abducted him on December 3, together with his two sons who were later released, to use as human shields while they were farming.

Around 5 December 2021 (between 3 - 7 December), in Kanbalu township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), a teacher participating in the civil disobedience movement (CDM) died in the military interrogation. He was arrested on December 3 in Sa Bai Nant Thar and brought to the military (6006) battalion.

Around 5 December 2021 (between 4 - 6 December), in Myeik town of Myeik township (Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), the owner of a restaurant was killed in the military interrogation. The military, police and special branch forces arrested him on December 3, accusing him of providing financial support to PDFs.

On 1 December 2021, in Ka Thea village of Sintgaing township (coded as Ka Thea Kone) (Kyaukse district, Mandalay region), the military arrested the owner of the Today tea shop and killed him in military interrogation on suspicion of providing finance to PDFs. The police said he stumbled and killed himself while he tried to escape. But a local said he was shot three times at his legs during the arrest and his arms were broken in the military interrogation. The military and police arrested his wife and a two-year-old son but they were released later.

On 29 November 2021, in Kaing Myauk village, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), a 25-years-old farmer was arrested by the Myanmar military forces for organizing illegal gathering of people. He was killed after 5 hours of his arrest after being beaten by police and military.

On 29 November 2021, in Ta Khun Taing village, Natmauk township (Magway district, Magway region), Myanmar military force arrested a woman in her 50s at her residence at around 1:30am and beat her for unknown reason.

Around 28 November 2021 (between 27 - 30 November), near Yae Shin village of Gangaw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), the villagers found three bodies of IDPs on November 30 outside the camp that was set on fire by the military on 27 November.

On 27 November 2021, in Twin Gyi village (Natmauk township, Magway district, Magway region), the military forces beat and arrested four locals including a CDM teacher at their homes for having links to a PDF.

On 27 November 2021, in Moke Pa Lin village (Kyaikto township, Thaton district, Mon state), a 80-year-old woman who lived in west of the Kyaw Garden and Kyel Sin petrol station was shot and killed by a long-range shot fired by the military forces hiding in the west of the Kyaw Garden while she was coming down to go to the toilet in her home compound.

On 23 November 2021, in Botahtaung Township (Yangon-east district, Yangon region), a 19-year old man was tortured and killed by military troops during interrogation . He and his father were arrested at their home on 54th Street on 22 November. The father was released later. Family was told to retrieve the body on 23 November.
On 23 November 2021, in Hpar Hsit village of Kutkai township (Muse district, Shan-North state), a military soldier from LIB 336 raped a 62-year-old woman.

Around 23 November 2021 (between 16 - 29 November), in Thingangyun township (Yangon-East, Yangon region), a civilian who was first arrested on 16 November died during military interrogation in custody on 29 November.

Around 23 November 2021 (between 22 - 23 November), near Maw Tawng village of Muse township (coded as Maw Tawng Ywar Ma) (Muse district, Shan-North state), following the fighting with a local defense force, the military LIB-99 abducted ten locals including a farmer on his way home from Ma Han Hill on 22 November on suspicion of being linked to PDF groups. On 23 November, villagers found the dead body of the farmer. Other detainees were released on 23 November.

On 22 November 2021, in Meiktila town (Meiktila township, Meiktila district, Mandalay region), the military forces opened fire and arrested a former chairman of the Meiktila University Students' Union and her father at her home.
On 21 November 2021, in Shwe Hlan village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military forces coming down from Kyauk Yit camp, Myaung township shot a young woman dead.

On 20 November 2021, in Loikaw town (Loikaw township, Loikaw district, Kayah), a 17-year-old man who was detained at the Loikaw Police Station was shot dead by the police and military. He had been arrested since last April and charged under Section 505 (a) of the Penal Code.

On 20 November 2021, in Se village, Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), around 80 Myanmar military troops arrested a woman at around 8 am and used her as human shield. Three houses were also burned down.

On 18 November 2021, in Nat Nan village of Wundwin township (coded as Wundwin) (Meiktila district, Mandalay region), about 80 military troops arrived and opened fire on the villagers as they fled in fear. Two men including a university student were killed and twelve other villagers were arrested.

On 18 November 2021, in Thanbyuzayat township (Mawlamyine district, Mon State) the Myanmar military shot dead a journalist and his wife who were traveling near a security checkpoint in Thanbyuzayat township. The military force shot them because they refused to stop at security check point.
On 18 November 2021, in Na Bar village (Indaw township, Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a freelance journalist. She was beaten during the arrest and her belongings were seized.
On 18 November 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), the military raided a private residence. Three INGO national staff members were injured by military forces during the raid.

On 17 November 2021, in Myin Thar village (Thabeikkyin Township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military arrested a 40-year-old teacher who was participating in the CDM and a villager on suspicion of having connection with the PDF. Both of them were beaten and a teacher was tortured to death in custody and died later on the same day.

Around 17 November 2021 (as reported), in Matupi town (Matupi township, Matupi district, Chin state), the military informed family members of a Christian pastor who had been arrested on 23 September that he died during interrogation.

properties.assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
properties.notes: On 16 November 2021, in Hpa Laung Taung village (Hpa-An township, Hpa-An district, Kayin state), the joint forces of the military and the Border Guard Force shot and wounded two female students returning from school.

On 15 November 2021, in Pekon township (Taunggyi district, Shan-south), the military arrested a volunteer who was helping displaced civilians at IDP camps along with other seven people. He was beaten during the arrest. He later died on 17 November during interrogation at 7th Military Operations Command (MOC-7), due to injuries consistent with torture.

On 15 November 2021, in Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), two civilians had been taken as guides by the military troops on the border between Kanpetlet Township and Saw Township. They had been tortured and sustained multiples wounds. Two days later, both of them fled with two guns seized from the military troops and one of them arrived at the PDF-Saw camp.

On 14 November 2021, in Yekyi Pauk village (Amarapura township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), a 13-year-old kid was taken hostage by the military after his 55-year-old father who is the supporter of the National League for Democracy (NLD) can not be located. His wife was also beaten by the military troops.

Around 13 November 2021 (between 12 - 13 November), in Kyauk Ta Dar village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military council arrested 2 civilians - the father and the uncle of a man under arrest warrant - at around 4 pm after they were not able to arrest the targeted man. His family was told to retrieve the uncle's body after 24 hours in custody. It was claimed that he was tortured and killed during interrogation and his head bore many injuries consistent with torture.

Around 13 November 2021 (between 12 - 13 November), in Payathikyar Village (Labutta Township, Labutta district, Ayeyarwady Region, a man who had been arrested on 12 November on suspicion of plotting a bomb blast were tortured to death and died during military interrogation on 13 November.

Around 12 November 2021 (between 15 October - 12 November), in Zee Kone village, Poke Ba Thi Ri township (Oke Ta Ra District, Nay Pyi Taw Region, a civilian who was arrested on 15 October died in custody on 12 November. He was tortured to death in interrogation after he appeared in court for his trial the day before on 11 November.

On 12 November 2021, in Madaya town (Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region) the military forces arrested and beat two teachers (a married couple) who joined Civil Disobedience Movement (CDM) at around 12 midnight for supporting civil servants who joined CDM movement.
On 11 November 2021, in Min Kone village (Wetlet township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces beat and arrested a young cowboy as he had NLD songs on his phone.

On 11 November 2021, in Kyauk Kar village of Palaw township (Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), the military forces shot and killed a female rubber plantation worker while clearing the area for no reason.

On 11 November 2021, in Akluai village (Tedim township, Falam district, Chin state), three military soldiers from the 22nd Light Infantry Headquarters raped a 27-year-old woman who gave birth just one and a half months ago in a house. She was raped multiple times in a night and her husband was beaten. Two of these three military soldiers also raped a seven months pregnant woman in the bathroom and confiscated her earrings.

On 10 November 2021, in Shan Ka Lone village (Kawlin township, Kawlin district, Sagaing), the military arrested two middle-aged men and a young man in his 20s after interrogating displaced villagers at the monastery. Locals said detainees were tortured.

Around 9 November 2021 (between 8 - 9 November), in Nat Ywar village (Htantabin township, Taungoo district, Bago-east), a 27-year-old man who was arrested on suspicion of bombing on 8 November died at the Htantabin township police station on 9 November. The military informed his family to retrieve his body.

Around 8 November 2021 (between 6 - 9 November), in Kungyangon township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), a man who was arrested by military forces on 6 November was tortured in military interrogation and died with injuries on the way to Yangon hospital.

On 7 November 2021, in Pauk Pin village of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), military soldiers went to the wrong house in search of a protest leader and shot at a woman who ran from shock. She was then brought in the car and the military sent her dead body back to the house next day.

On 7 November 2021, in Hpar Khit village of Kutkai township (Muse district, Shan-North state), a soldier from the military LIB-336 raped a 62-year-old woman while she was home alone after soldiers stole food from her home. The soldier was reported to the relevant senior officer.

On 7 November 2021, in Madaw village (Palaw township, Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), the military's Infantry Battalion (IB-285) arrested and interrogated nearly 20 villagers. Some were released later but more than 10 are still being held on suspicion of having connection with the KNU. Locals stated that the faces of three of those released were swollen after being beaten.

On 5 November 2021, in Myaing township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces in civilian clothes took away local women which were used as human shields during a clash (clash coded separately), according to PDF-Myaing.

On 3 November 2021, in Taung Maw village (Kawlin township, Kawlin district, Sagaing region), four men, including a high school teacher, were killed by military soldiers who had been stationed in the village since 2 November.

Around 2 November 2021 (between 1 - 2 November), in Ywar Bo village, Sintgaing township (Kyaukse District, Mandalay Region), a 32-year-old man, a high school teacher, was killed during interrogation on 2 November after the Myanmar military arrested him on 1 November for joining the civil disobedience movement. The man died from injuries consistent with torture.

On 2 November 2021, in Madaya town (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay), military troops arrested and beat up three youths, including a CDM teacher, on suspicion of having connection with the PDF.

On 1 November 2021, in Tha Yet Kan village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), two farmers from Tha Yet Kan and one farmer from Myannandar ward were shot dead while fetching water in a field. They were killed by members of the military troops and Pyu Saw Htee members when they were passing by in two cars.

On 31 October 2021, in Chauk township (Magway district, Magway region), the military tortured and killed one of three brothers in military interrogation center within a few hours after arresting them. Three brothers who were private teachers were accused of providing finance to PDFs.

On 31 October 2021, in Hlwe Te village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military forces shot and arrested three youths who were doing charity work at the funeral of the monk at the monastery. A local claimed that they were arrested for being informants of the PDF.

On 31 October 2021, in Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah State), one or two displaced villagers were shot dead by military troops while returning to their village to get food. Fatalities coded as 1.

Around 30 October 2021 (between 30 - 31 October), in In Ngoke To village of Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and arrested a farmer. Villagers found his dead body next day in fields.
On 29 October 2021, in Kywe Te village of Taze township (coded as Taze) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces stationed at the Kywe Te village shot and arrested a woman.

On 29 October 2021, in Pa Leik (Ywar Ma) (Sintgaing township, Kyaukse district, Mandalay region), the military troops arrested a 27-year-old CDM teacher and 40-year-old man in connection with the killing of a local administrator the day before.

Around 28 October 2021 (between 27 - 29 October), in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), three NLD supporters living in London Win Ward were arrested by military soldiers on 27 October. The families of two of the detainees were informed on 29 October to retrieve their bodies. Their bodies were found to bear stab wounds and injuries consistent with torture.

On 28 October 2021, in Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), a former political prisoner was killed in military interrogation center. His body was broken and his head was crashed. He was released on October 19 and re-arrested on October 28.

On 26 October 2021, in Ngathaingchaung town (Yegyi township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), an assistant abbot (Buddhist) and a novice were shot by the military forces on their way back from shopping. The assistant abbot was killed and the novice was wounded.

On 24 October 2021, in Ywar Thit Kone village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), as the military advanced towards the village, the military forces detained a farmer living in a hut on his farm and shot him to death near the village. His body was then set on fire behind a monastery. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 24 October 2021, in Homalin town (Homalin Township, Hkamti District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided a house of a protest leader at night. During the raid, his sister-in-law who was also a teacher who joined the civil disobedience movement was shot and killed by the military. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
On 23 October 2021, near Rialti village (Falam Township, Falam District, Chin State), the Myanmar military shot and killed a medical doctor working for the Chin National Front.

Around 21 October 2021 (between 19 - 22 October), in Taungoo town of Taungoo township (Taungoo district, Bago-East region), one of the two youths who were arrested on October 19 in relation to an explosion died at the hospital on 21 October from wounds consistent with torture which were sustained during military interrogation. The second detainee also died in military custody on 22 October.

Around 17 October 2021 (month of), in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), a flight engineer who was arrested on September 11 on accusation of trying to sabotage an Air KBZ flight died in the Insein prison care center from a heart attack on 17 October. His family did not find torture-related wounds on his body but believed it was a mental torture that killed him as his health deteriorated in prison.

On 10 October 2021, in Pon Nar Gyi village in Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), about 50 military soldiers arrived at the village and searched the houses of NLD supporters and alleged PDF members. They also temporarily detained and beat a villager.

On 9 October 2021, in San Pya Chauk Maing village (Demoso township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), two refugees returning home to get food were shot and arrested by the military forces. One was killed and another got injured in his head.

On 9 October 2021, in Ah Lel Taw village of Tigyaing township (Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a teacher participating in the civil disobedience movement (CDM). The Tigyaing PDF reported that he was killed during the arrest but this information cannot be verified.

On 5 October 2021, in Yae Lel Thaung village of Ngazun township (coded as Yae Lel Thaung (East)) (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military beat and arrested 7 locals including a monk in relation to the killing of military informants in Sin Hpyu Kone village.

On 5 October 2021, in Dwei Loe village of Hpapun township (coded as Hpapun) (Hpapun district, Kayin state), the military's LIB 405 used six villagers including 4 women and 2 men from Waw Wi Lay village to carry food and guide them in the battlefield. Of six villagers, a 60-year-old woman was injured in times of fighting.

Around 5 October 2021 (between 4 - 6 October), in Hlegu township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), a charity worker who was arrested by the military on 4 October later died while in military custody on 6 October.

On 5 October 2021, in Tha Pyay Thar village of Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military and police beat and arrested three women, family members of their intended target. They also arrested a 60-year-old man. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 2 October 2021 (between 1 - 3 October), in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), an aid worker who was arrested by military forces on 1 October in in San Gyi Wa ward later died while in custody on October 3. The aid worker had been providing support to young anti-coup protesters who were arrested by the military forces.

Around 1 October 2021 (month of), in Zay Yar Thi Ri township (Oke Ta Ra district, Nay Pyi Taw), a detainee died from severe injuries and wounds while receiving treatment at military hospital. He was arrested on 2 May and had been tortured by the military for five months. He died on 1 October. His mother witnessed bruises, broken ribs and injured body organs on his body.

On 26 September 2021, in Hman Taw village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces raided the village and arrested two villagers and one CDM medical staff. The military then killed all three of them.
On 26 September 2021, in Dawei township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), a first year student from Dawei University was arrested and beaten by the Myanmar military at his home.

On 25 September 2021, in Myaynigone area of Sanchaung township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the military grabbed four young people from their apartment and killed them on the road. Two of the victims were a doctor and a nurse participating in the civil disobedience movement (CDM). They also actively protested against the Myanmar military coup.

On 25 September 2021, in Kanpetlet township (Mindat district, Chin state), the military stationed in Kanpetlet airport shot and killed three IDPs who came to carry food and rations from their villages.
On 20 September 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), the military fired at and arrested three young people including two university students at their houses.
On 19 September 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the military arrested seven young activists. A Students' Union member was also beaten during the arrest.

On 18 September 2021, in Thantlang town (Thantlang township, Hakha district, Chin state), the military shot and killed a pastor of the Thantlang Century Roman Catholic church who tried to put out flames caused by the military artillery shelling. They also cut his finger off and looted his wedding ring.

On 17 September 2021, in Letpadan township (Thayarwady district, Bago-West region), a man was tortured and killed in military custody after he was accused of killing the military-appointed Village Administrator' personnel. He was one of 30 arrestees arrested on 16 September. The family found brusies and wounds on his dead body.

On 17 September 2021, in Myo Lu Lin village, Myothit township (Magway district, Magway region), Myanmar military forces shot a non-CDM teacher and beat a child who was with the teacher. The teacher later died at the hospital on 18 September 2021.

properties.assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
properties.notes: On 16 September 2021, in Ywar Ma, 115 mile in Muse Township, Muse District, Shan State, a car carrying military soldiers and PMF troops hit two women who were walking on the street. One died and one injuried. Fatalities coded as 1.

Around 16 September 2021 (between 14 - 17 September), in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay), a young man who was arrested by military soldiers on 14 September with five other youths on allegations of making weapons later died while in custody on 17 September.

Around 16 September 2021 (between 14 - 16 September), in Kale Township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), an arrestee was tortured and killed during interrogation. He was arrested and brought to Kale Regional Operation Command on suspicion of making handmade rifles on September 14.

On 15 September 2021, in Se Taw village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers entered the village and fired gunshots indiscriminately. A bullet injured an elderly woman.

On 15 September 2021, in Aungpan Town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan South), the Myanmar military arrested a daughter of a veteran. The reason for the arrest was unknown. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 15 September 2021, in Pan village (Pale Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers raided the village and arrested about 40 villagers, including one health officer who joined the civil disobedience movement. The military beat all detainees. Detainees were released again on the following day. The military also searched houses and destroyed properties. Villagers fled to other safe areas.

On 15 September 2021, in Pan village (Pale Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers shouted 'GZ' and fired gunshots at 7 youths while youth were returning home after herding cattle. A bullet injured one youth, and the military also arrested all of them.

On 14 September 2021, in Taung Bet village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the pro-military group Pyu Saw Htee and military soldiers detained and killed a woman. She worked as an accountant for Pauk People's Defense Force. The military also took 180 lakhs Myanmar kyats when they detained him.

On 14 September 2021, in Bi Kho village (Twantay Township, Yangon-South District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military and police detained and killed two villagers, including aid workers. The military accused them of being a member of the People's Defense Force. Fatalities coded as 2.

On 9 September 2021, in Taungdwingyi township (Magway district, Magway region), military forces conducted a search operation for suspected PDF members and opened fire at tents near Bam Kone Dam, injuring a youth. The tents were temporary shelters belonging to farmers who were cultivating on the vacant land near the dam.

On 8 September 2021, in Demoso Township (Loikaw District, Kayah State), the Myanmar military abducted two IDPs on their way back home from IDP camp and used them as human shields during their offensive activity in Demoso township.

properties.assoc_actor_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
properties.notes: On 8 September 2021, in Thanlyin township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), the military arrested and killed a 19-year-old man during interrogation at the ward office. Locals witnessed that the 100-Household Head tied him up to a lamp post and beat him, asking if he is a PDF member.
On 7 September 2021, in Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military hit a university student with a car and arrested him in front of Sagarhla pagoda.
On 4 September 2021, in Shwe Pyi Aye village of Pekon township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the military arrested two farmers to use as human shields for their military convoys.

On 3 September 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago-West district), the military arrested three high school students on suspicion of being connected to anti-coup organizations. One was beaten during the arrest.

On 1 September 2021, in Thea Ein village (Paung Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military shot a pregnant woman and also a mother of a 4-year-old child dead. She was shot on her way back home after greeting a couple returning home from a river after fishing.
On 1 September 2021, in Kyainseikgyi township (Kawkareik District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military abducted a 30-year-old woman as a hostage after the Myanmar military and KNLA clashed.

properties.assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Police
properties.notes: On 31 August 2021, in U Hla Hpay village of Buthidaung township (Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), the military LIB 551 and the BGP arrested and tortured a Rohingya small-scale sawmill owner in a military interrogation regarding the death of an army officer. He was released on the next day after paying two million kyat.

Around 30 August 2021 (between 29 - 31 August), in Maungdaw town (Maungdaw Township, Maungdaw District, Rakhine State), a Rohingya Muslim village administrator for U Shey Kya village who was arrested by officers from the Military Security Affairs on 29 August while at the Maungdaw District Administration Office later died in Myanmar military custody on 31 August. He was arrested on suspicion of working with the ARSA and trading in illicit drugs and detained and tortured for two days at the office of the Military Security Affairs.

On 27 August 2021, at the town entry gate of Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military forced everyone who passed through to get down on their knees and raise their hands. The military touched the private parts of women as they inspected the women.

On 27 August 2021, in Min Taing Pin village of Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a charity worker as the charity worker had a profile frame in support of the NUG on his Facebook profile. He was also beaten in the head.

Around 25 August 2021 (between 24 - 25 August), in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a young man who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in Yadarnarbon ward on 24 August later died on 25 August while in custody. While security forces claimed that he had died of coronavirus, his family stated that his body was found with injuries consistent with torture.

On 24 August 2021, in Kayan township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), the military shot and arrested a man who was passing by the Kayan police station. He was then beaten during interrogation later died from torture on the same day while in custody.

Around 24 August 2021 (between 22 - 25 August), in South Okkalapa township (Yangon city-East district, Yangon region), a 19-year-old man who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) on 22 August on suspicion of being involved in the bombing of the township administration office later died while detained at the interrogation centre on 25 August. His family reportedly had to pay 1 million kyats to retrieve his body and found that his body was bruised and swollen.

Around 23 August 2021 (between 22 - 23 August), in Thaketa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), a man who had been participating in anti-coup protests and was arrested by military soldiers on 22 August later died overnight while in custody. His family was informed to retrieve his body on 23 August. AAPP reported that he died due to torture during interrogation.

Around 23 August 2021 (between 22 - 23 August), in Nyaungshwe township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), a primary school teacher who was arrested on 22 August for unknown reasons later died in Nyaungshwe prison on 23 August. His family was informed that he died by COVID-19 although a local close to him said that the teacher was in good health before the arrest. A prison officer claimed that a 25-year-old detainee (likely the same person) died in prison due to a heart attack.

Around 20 August 2021 (between 18 - 21 August), in Hnan Khar village (Gangaw township, Gangaw district, Magway region), an elderly man who was arrested by military soldiers at his home on 18 August later died on 21 August. He reportedly escaped from detention on 21 August, hours before his death, and told other villagers that he was severely tortured by soldiers during his detention.

Around 19 August 2021 (between 18 - 19 August), in Kyauk Kan village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), a man who was arrested by military troops on the night of 18 August later died in the morning of 19 August. He was reportedly beaten and tortured overnight while in detention, with severe injuries to his face and head.

On 13 August 2021, in Budalin town (Budalin Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military arrested a medical doctor and a court office clerk who joined the civil disobedience movement against the military coup. He was beaten during the arrest.

On 13 August 2021, near Waingmaw town (Waingmaw Township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military battalion-58 shot at a couple on a motorcycle who were passing through a road in front of the battalion as they were returning home from grocery shopping in Waingmaw on the evening. The wife was killed while the husband managed to escape.

properties.assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
properties.notes: On 10 August 2021, between Kyoe Waing and Myit Kyoe village (Bilin Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military IB-406 and BGF battalion 1013 used women as human shields as they advanced towards Kyoe Waing from Myit Kyoe village.

On 8 August 2021, near Me Oe and Let Yet Kone villages (coded as Let Yet Kone) (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), about 100 military soldiers came and shot indiscriminately at the surrounding villages. A farmer from Let Yet Kone village was injured from the rounds.

On 6 August 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), about 20 members of the armed forces in civilian clothes raided a house in Ward 7 and arrested a younger brother instead of the person who was targeted after being charged with article 505(a). The younger brother was beaten in interrogation. Both his legs were broken. The military informed the family about his status but did not allow medical treatment.

Around 4 August 2021 (month of), in Ye town (Ye township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the authorities informed relatives that a prisoner died due to diabetes. The relatives were allowed to see his face only. His teeth and eyes were wounded. It is believed that the authorities (believed to be the military and police) beat him to death.

On 2 August 2021, in Kin Ma village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military beat aid workers. The military beat them on their way back from Kin Ma village after transporting IDPs supports to the village.

On 31 July 2021, in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military forces in civilian clothes hit three students with a private car. The students were returning home on a motorbike after participating in a protest. One of them was arrested.

On 31 July 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), a 23-year-old man who was arrested on 20 July in relation to the explosion of Shwe Nan Taw jewel shop owned by one of the SAC members died at the Shwepyithar interrogation center. He was allegedly beaten during interrogation.

Around 29 July 2021 (between 19 July - 8 August), in Oo Bo prison in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), a CDM doctor who was arrested on July 19 on suspicion of being connected to CRPH/NUG died from coronavirus and due to lack of access to medical treatment.

On 28 July 2021, in Taung Hpyu village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), four of the 57 PDF members were killed after they were captured by the military and Pyu Saw Htee members, according to a PDF member.

On 27 July 2021, in Pyinmana town (Pyinmana township, Det Khi Na district, Nay Pyi Taw), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) beat and arrested a student protest leader. A planned protest by students on the same day was cancelled after the leader was arrested.

Around 21 July 2021 (as reported), in Mingin township police station, Mingin town (Kale district, Sagaing region), the former chairwoman of the city development council who was first arrested and charged in March 2021 died in custody on 21 July after being denied medical treatment for diabetes and heart failure.

On 21 July 2021, in Thabyu village, Taikkyi township (coded as Taikkyi) (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), about 100 military troops raided the village and arrested three current and former student union members. The father of one of the student union members was also arrested. They were beaten and taken for investigation.

On 16 July 2021, near Tha Hngar village (Sinbaungwe Township, Thayet District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military fired several gunshots at a farmer who is also the father of an NLD lawmaker who competed and won the 2020 general election. He was shot at his farm field and died.

On 16 July 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) beat and arrested a medical doctor. The military regime has been targeting health workers who are providing support to coronavirus patients privately.

On 15 July 2021, near Min Kone village (Wetlet Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military conducted a security measure after a Thit Seint Gyi village administrator was killed near Min Kone village. They fired gunshots at two travellers on a motorcycle and arrested a goat herder.

On 14 July 2021, near Nwan Lang village, Momauk township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), one woman was raped and killed by 3 soldiers from Myanmar military forces. Three soldiers from the Myanmar military brigade 88 and LIB 616 were found with the dead woman's mobile phone. The Myanmar military paid 2,100,000 kyats to the victim's family in compensation.

On 13 July 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) beat and arrested a medical doctor along with his cousin. Later, his cousin was released.

On 10 July 2021, on a bridge between Kyun Pin Thar village and Min Thar village (Tamu township, Tamu district, Sagaing region), the military forces shot 6 young people who returned from nearby villages to Kyun Pin Thar. Two killed on the spot while military forces arrested the remaining four, of which 3 were reportedly injured. Two of those detained were tortured to death on the same day. Family members did not receive the dead bodies of the two who died. Fatalities coded as 4.

On 10 July 2021, in Thongwa township (Yangon-South, Yangon region), military forces arrested and severely beat a man for not walking correctly while he was looking for oxygen for a COVID-19 patient. He died on the same day from wounds in head and back.

On 7 July 2021, in Waingmaw township (Myitkyina District, Kachin State), a female street vendor who was selling fruits at a roadside market near Balaminhtin Bridge was shot and killed by a stray bullet fired by a group of military soldiers. The soldiers was reportedly firing at a vehicle that failed to stop for inspection.
