On 5 July 2021, in Nyaung Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided villages and randomly fired gunshots. A woman in her 40s was shot dead in Nyaung Kone village. She was riding a motorbike on the Shwebo-Myitkyina highway with her child when soldiers in a military truck shot at them.

On 4 July 2021, in Thegone village near Hopin town (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), more than 30 military soldiers entered a monastery and beat up monks and villagers, and destroyed properties in the monastery. Military troops reportedly raided the monastery after there were claims of weapons hidden in the monastery.

Around 30 June 2021 (between 29 June - 1 July), in Pyay township (Pyay district, Bago region), a man who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) on 29 June later died while in custody. His family was asked to retrieve his body on 1 July. His family found that his entire body had torture marks and bruises while his chest had been stitched together. Security forces claimed that he died of an epileptic seizure.

Around 29 June 2021 (between 26 June - 1 July), in Shwedaung town (Shwedaung township, Pyay district, Bago region), a 19-year-old boy who was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) on 26 June later died on 1 July while in custody. His body was cremated by security forces without the permission of his family. He was first arrested by security forces after he was filmed shouting insults at the military's commander-in chief. Security forces claimed that he died from internal bleeding, while some residents claimed that they saw security forces beating the detainee while they were taking him to the military base.

On 22 June 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military raided a house, and shot a 15-year-old boy (a grade 9 student) with a rubber bullet and arrested him.

On 17 June 2021, in Aing Gyi village (coded as Aing Gyi (Ywar Ma)) (Kawlin Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), military soldiers stormed the village and opened fire as villagers fled in fear. A 50-year-old woman was shot and injured.

On 15 June 2021, in Kun Saik village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), two villagers who were arrested and detained by military forces on 15 June were tortured and died while in custody on the same day. The military ordered a charitable organization to bury their bodies while making a confession not to disclose details of the burial. It was said that one of them was the son of an NLD member.

Around 14 June 2021 (between 13 - 14 June), in Inn Te village (Taungtha Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), a man who was arrested by the Myanmar military on suspicion of killing an alleged Myanmar military informant on 13 June died while in military custody on 14 June. He was one of four people arrested on 13 June in relation to the attack.

On 14 June 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military made an anonymous phone call to a Buddhist monk and lied to him to meet them. Afterwards, the Myanmar military soldiers beat and arrested him. The monk was one of the Hpayargyi Peace Protest column leaders.
On 14 June 2021, in Manton township (Pa Laung Self-Administered Zone, Shan-North State), two ethnic Lisu women were raped by a military soldier while they were searching for mushrooms.

Around 11 June 2021 (between 8 - 13 June), in Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), an activist who arrested on 8 July was tortured during his interrogation while detained at the Monywa interrogation centre. He reportedly had his fingers broken during the interrogation. He was later transferred on 13 June and detained in Monywa Prison.

On 6 June 2021, in Magway town (Magway township, Magway district, Magway region), security forces (coded as military and police) beat up and arrested six university students in front of No. 3 Basic Education High School.

On 5 June 2021, in Bant Bway village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military stormed the village and opened fire. A female villager was shot and killed. One other civilian was arrested.

On 5 June 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a filmmaker at her house. She was beaten and seriously injured. Afterwards, she was hospitalized for 10 days.

Around 4 June 2021 (week of), in Nam Hpat Kar village (Kutkai township, Muse district, Shan-North), a 14-year-old ethnic Ta'ang Buddhist nun was raped twice by a soldier from Bridge-99 who was stationed at the monastery. She was offered 500,000 kyats and asked to leave the monastery out of fear that the news would spread. [women targeted: girls]

On 3 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested and beat up two people for being involved in the Sein Pan anti-coup protest group.

On 2 June 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), the military arrested eight youths after an informant reported that they were allegedly storing weapons. Four of them were tied up and beaten near the Zayar Thiri Monastery.

On 1 June 2021, in Mahaaungmyay Township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed a Buddhist monastery and fired either rubber bullets or live rounds at monks who were holding a prayer service for the release of those detained by the military junta. A monk was injured while fleeing. No arrests were made.
On 1 June 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military soldiers insulted a monk and shot him dead.
